entry.title: CocoaHeads November 2009 Meeting Agenda
entry.content:
Next CocoaHeads meeting is Thursday, November 19th at Indy Hall.

This month, Joe Walsh will talk about HTTP Live Streaming.

There is still plenty of room on the schedule for talks or show & tell!

Agenda

  • Meet & Greet - Communicate with other humans using the high bandwidth "face-to-face" protocol.
  • General News
  • Scheduled Talks
    • HTTP Live Streaming
  • Show and Tell, Open Talks
  • Open Hack - Bring projects and questions

entry.title: CocoaHeads October 2009 Meeting Agenda
entry.content:
Next CocoaHeads meeting is Thursday, October 15th at Indy Hall (NEW LOCATION).

After much discussion, we sorted out the location situation, and we're staying at Indy Hall! The location is just a few blocks away from where we previously met.

This month, Rob Hall (@rhall) will talk about the newly-announced capability of using Flash to develop iPhone applications.

There is still plenty of room on the schedule for talks or show & tell!

Agenda

  • Meet & Greet - Communicate with other humans using the high bandwidth "face-to-face" protocol.
  • General News
  • Scheduled Talks
    • Flash for iPhone Apps
  • Show and Tell, Open Talks
  • Open Hack - Bring projects and questions

entry.title: CocoaHeads September 2009 Meeting Agenda
entry.content:
Next CocoaHeads meeting is Thursday, September 10th at Indy Hall (NEW LOCATION).

After much discussion, we sorted out the location situation, and we're staying at Indy Hall! The location is just a few blocks away from where we previously met.

This month, Andy Mroczkowski will give a brief overview of the new Image Capture Core framework in 10.6, and we'll also have some updates on other things going on, such as the iPhone Deviation events.

There is still plenty of room on the schedule for talks or show & tell!

Agenda

  • Meet & Greet - Communicate with other humans using the high bandwidth "face-to-face" protocol.
  • General News
    • iPhone Deviation & ShareUrMeal collaboration
  • Show and Tell, Open Talks
  • Scheduled Talks
    • What is Image Capture Core, and why you should care by @amrox
  • Open Hack - Bring projects and questions

entry.title: CocoaHeads August 2009 Meeting Agenda
entry.content:
Next CocoaHeads meeting is Thursday, August 13th at Indy Hall Classic (same place, new (temporary) name).

Our first Philadelphia CocoaHeads meeting was in August of 2008, so this marks PhillyCocoa's first birthday (woo). To celebrate, we'll have some extra snacks and refreshments along with our regularly scheduled awesome content. We're also accepting donations to fund this event, and keep PhillyCocoa going strong. It's not too late to pledge!

This month, Philip Fominykh will give a talk about using Common Lisp on Mac technology. Lisp is a very old and influential language which helped inspire SmallTalk, and it turn, Objective-C. It should be really interesting.

Also we'll have some updates on other things going on, such as the iPhone Deviation events.

Agenda

  • Meet & Greet - Communicate with other humans using the high bandwidth "face-to-face" protocol.
  • General News
    • iPhone Deviation & ShareUrMeal collaboration
    • iPhoneDevCamp Redux?
  • Show and Tell, Open Talks
  • Scheduled Talks
    • Common Lisp on the Mac - Philip Fominykh
  • Open Hack - Bring projects and questions

entry.title: CocoaHeads July 2009 Meeting Agenda
entry.content:
Next CocoaHeads meeting is Thursday, July 9th at Indy Hall Classic (same place, new (temporary) name).

This month, the developers from labs @ laan will talk about bringing TweetDeck to the small screen. We'll also might talk about some more of those exciting new technologies that have been popping up lately.

Agenda

  • Meet & Greet - Communicate with other humans using the high bandwidth "face-to-face" protocol.
  • General News
  • iPhoneDevCamp Updates
  • Scheduled Talks
    • Bringing TweetDeck to the small screen.
    • Something new and exciting.
  • Show and Tell, Open Talks
  • Open Hack - Bring projects and questions
